meanings.definition: Having or showing great knowledge or learning.
meanings.sent1: She is an erudite scholar, always eager to share her vast knowledge with others.
meanings.sent2: The professor's erudite lectures captivated the students with their depth and insight.
meanings.sent3: Despite his erudite demeanor, he still enjoys watching silly cartoons on weekends.
meanings.sent4: Her erudite analysis of the novel shed new light on its themes and symbolism.
meanings.sent5: The library was a treasure trove of erudite books, waiting to be explored.

meanings.definition: A person who has or displays great knowledge or learning.
meanings.sent1: The erudite in the group was always sought after for advice on various topics.
meanings.sent2: As an erudite, she was respected for her wisdom and intellect among her peers.
meanings.sent3: The erudite at the party entertained everyone with fascinating trivia facts.
meanings.sent4: In the world of academia, he was known as an erudite, publishing numerous scholarly articles.
meanings.sent5: The erudite's presence at the conference elevated the level of intellectual discourse.
